title: What happens if I keep my car running and leave with the keyless entry keys? - Quora

response.answer_text: In keyless entry with pushbutton start systems, key is needed only for starting the car. Once the engine starts, it is possible to leave the car, with the engine still running. The engine would continue to run till it runs out of fuel. Please note that it is illegal to leave the vehicle unattended, with the engine running. My daughter learned this the hard way. A few months ago, she had gone to a hotel. She decided to avail the services of valet parking. She got off the car, with the engine running, and the valet got into the driver's seat and drove it towards the parking site. My daughter had forgotten to handover the fob to the valet. The valet realised the missing fob only after parking. He could not lock or start the car without the fob. the car was already running so he didn’t need to start the car. The fob isn’t needed to lock a car, as you can lock it with the switch inside the car.

I have a Prius and a Honda jazz or fit both with push button start and remote fob and I have left both of them ready in the Prius and running with the jazz and got a surprise when I came back that they were both ready to drive off the jazz used fuel the whole time and the Prius none. Now I don’t use the park brake on the Prius and it beeps if I open the door with it in the ready mode reminding me to push the button and it engages park when off by itself. I haven’t found a solution with the Honda but will probably sell it as it is smaller less smother ride and uses 30% more fuel than the Prius and get an electric car a second hand Tesla model S.

Some car may keep running even without the key fob around (they were only used to start the engine). And some car ping periodically for the key fob and behave differently when the key not around. In my experience with a rented Hyundai Elantra, I left the car with engine running to take some picture outside (and the key fob is with me) and my wife is still in the car. The car started to beep with an error shown on the dashboard saying key not found after I move few meters away. However, the engine still running and did not switch off. Not sure if the car can still be driven away though and we didn’t try that.

The cars constantly looks for(pings) the keyless keyfob using RF to determine where it is. If you leave the car running and exit, but stay near the car, it’ll keep running. If you move more than a preset distance( 2–4 meters), it’ll switch off and lock the doors in 30 seconds or so.
